title: Since iOS Safari 15.4 has been released, try a new CSS element (svh, lvh, dvh)
body:
Until now, if the content height was determined based on `VH` on the iPhone, the display/hiding of the URL bar could not be detected, and unnecessary scrolling has occurred.

The methods so far have been responded in the following forms.

`` `css
.container {
    Height: -WEBKIT-FILL-AVAILABLE
}
`` `

As a problem with this method, there was a very difficult case when the height was determined by calculation processing, which could not be used as an argument of `Calc ()`.

This time, I will introduce how to do it because it was solved by the release of 15.4.

[Safari 15.4 Release Note]

Among them, SVH, LVH, DVH is described.

-Small ViewPort (SVH)
-A value that subtracts the height of the URL bar, etc. from the display size
-Large ViewPort (LvH)
-A value that subtracts all heights, such as the minimized URL bar from the display size
-Dynamic viewport (DVH)
-A value that fluctuates from the display size to the size of the URL bar

## At the end

This is saved from the spell of iOS ...

Only iOS15.4 or later is compatible with SVH, LVH, and DVH, and does not support anything else (including PC Chrome). Therefore, VH must be described for other browser correspondence.
